channel.title: Mouse
channel.description:
Well I needed to learn Maya for a new job, so here's my first object. It's the mouse I'm currently using. I didn't bother texturing it or making kickass materials, I really just needed to learn a modeling workflow. Also experimented with curves for this.
Now, back to the BMW lol.
[img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/one.jpg[/img]

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:330767”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=427139.msg3137198#msg3137198 date=1267129271]
But AR sucks worse than MR when it comes to professional renders IMO.
[/quote]
The 11 AR is actually very nice, but whats stopping you from using VRay? Dont legally own it so you cannot use it to produce stuff?

C4D runs well on Macs and is just enough for modeling. Like i said AR is good for quick fast renders for showing off models or making an object look photo real. For interiors it sorta sucks though.[/quote]

C4D is not good for modeling anything other than Motion Graphics really… And that’s just because of MoGraph and the integration for After Effects. AR is not fast and neither photoreal. No doubt there are artists who work with AR and make photoreal images, but it’s all trickery and cheating. Maya is by far the most popular 3D modeling/animation/etc suite in the industry, with 3DS Max at it’s side and other specialty programs like Houdini and Modo.

It’s not like I’m working from home and I can use what I want. I’m working for a company who run on Macs and there is no 3DS Max for Mac, only Maya. So the obvious choice is Maya. They also have Mental Ray for Maya. They’re not going to buy something else just for me lol.

Adam:

Nah, Logitech. Dunno the model but it’s one of the small ones.

Nope, that one looks like a ripoff.

[img]http://img.game.co.uk/ml/3/3/9/9/339966ps_500h.jpg[img]

Mine’s more sharp, the curves are slightly different, and like I said I didn’t go into texturing so there’s no arrow on the button, Microsoft on the back part, or light in the middle.

Read full topic

@Frell wrote:

SomethingToHide:

But AR sucks worse than MR when it comes to professional renders IMO.

The 11 AR is actually very nice, but whats stopping you from using VRay? Dont legally own it so you cannot use it to produce stuff?

AR3:

C4D runs well on Macs and is just enough for modeling. Like i said AR is good for quick fast renders for showing off models or making an object look photo real. For interiors it sorta sucks though.

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:330767”]God dammit are you just going to use every program? IIRC most companies in the industry allow you to use the programs you find suitable for a good and efficient workflow and that gets the job done.

If you’re going to use maya you can say bye bye to VRay :([/quote]

Depends what they have and how it fits into their pipeline. However, the place I’m at now is Mac based, so no Max. They have Maya, and maybe C4D.

I just tried Mental Ray and I hated it a lot, but that’s all they have so I’ll have to deal.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:3, topic:330767”][quote author=Frell link=topic=427139.msg3136798#msg3136798 date=1267061227]
God dammit are you just going to use every program? IIRC most companies in the industry allow you to use the programs you find suitable for a good and efficient workflow and that gets the job done.

If you’re going to use maya you can say bye bye to VRay
[/quote]

Maya mental ray is pretty good imo so no big deal.[/quote]
You haven’t used Vray though. I read a comparison a while ago and VRay won against Mental with photo-realistic renders.

Mental: http://andrewellrodt.com/gameRoom.jpg
VRay: http://fc09.deviantart.net/fs36/f/2008/254/c/7/living_room___3_dimension_by_Rusty_Shutter.jpg

But either way he can always render in max, and it depends on what you’re going for. Im sure they both one up each other in certain ways.

Read full topic
